replies.body:
I'm not going to take away any of TSM's merits for winning such a major tournament. It requires a lot of work and effort to do so. So salty NA fanboys go away, but honestly;
TSM number 6? They won a major international after 2 Bo1 and 2 series (Bo3 and Bo5) against the weakest teams in the tournament. You can say it was pretty much "gifted" in that sense.
How many analysts take their time to make this? Have you ever heard of the term "outlier"? 
I don't follow China that much though I know EDG is doing great so I guess you can place them above GE Tigers. 
What you CANNOT do is put down the Tigers just because they had ONE bad performance against a team they didn't practise for becasue they didn't expect to face them. THAT is the outlier. As much as you can't call TSM the number 6 in the world just because they had an outlier performance in a "gifted" tournament.
The same way you can't place SK below CLG after a "bad" performance in a tournament that CLG didn't even make it in. There's a saying here that says "To lose the first place, you had to be first once". To perform bad in a Major, you first gotta make it in.
I repeat, salty NA fans, let me leave this clear; EU is better than NA, yet NA is performing way better when it matters.
And again, to analyse properly, you gotta isolate the outliers. And you, beloved redaction section, should learn to do so.

You can't just say EU is better then Na without any tangible evidence........you say that they are "clearly better", but don't show up "when it matters". If anything, your comment supports that NA is better because they show up and win and advance in major tournaments (last year's worlds NA had 2 quarter finalists vs EU's none, C9 advancing further then European teams at San Jose, and the improved TSM just won IEM while EU teams didn't even advance to the finals). Maybe you are caught in some bizarre reality where Fanatic winning the championship in Season 1 makes EU better then NA, but when comparing recent success at international tournaments.... I'm going to have to say that NA has shown an increase in potency, while EU seeming has fallen behind as of late. Don't claim others sound salty when you yourself are the one that sounds like you are the salty one........Kaboom baby
That's your problem, in everything I said you just got your eyes into that. Though I made myself clear that NA is doing way better. If you can call North American teams to be from NA, obviously...

Just because a player originates from a different region doesn't mean they aren't from NA. Bjergson may have come from Europe and Lustboy may have come from Korea, but they still represent the North American LCS, like it or not. The LPL has many Korean players playing on Chinese teams. Another example, one of the top teams in Europe right now, Fanatic, has two Korean players. Does that make them a Korean team playing for the LCK? No it doesn't, they still represent the European LCS.  Where you grow your talent doesn't matter, it's where you use it that counts.
Clearly we know who the winner is..ding ding ding: The Green 8 Ball!

Lust, San, And Bjerg are Professional NA players. They play for a NA team. They might be from other countries but that does not make them just EU and Kor Players... Same thing happens in other sports. Paul Gasol is from Spain but you do not call him just a Spanish Basketball Player. You would call him a Professional NBA player from spain or just a NBA player or even a Professional basketball player in america also. So call them Eu players and Kor players all you want, it does not change that they are NA professional players and represent NA in Tourneys.
oh, i <3 you. all the EU fanboys gotta pick on TSM for having 2 danes and a korean but their pride and joy has koreans too but you don't see them talking about that

Exactly this. Lets look at a sport like Football/Soccer. An example is Chelsea, a team in ENGLAND that has a majority of players from OUTSIDE England. The only English players that actually play are John Terry and Gary Cahill. Do we call them the best Spanish team because there Spanish players are good? Or Brazilian for the same reason? No They are an ENGLISH club who are currently the best ENGLISH team in football. 

3/5 of TSM could be from Cambodia for all i care, if they are playing in NA they are still  a North American team representing North America
@Kitten Lover - Fake tournament? so the $100,000 and big ass trophy they won was fake? damn....

EU has underperformed every time.  And no you can't call this Tourney gifted to TSM.  You play who you play and that's it.  People could have seen TSM vs GE if they made it there.  TSM beat the #1 GPL team and then 3-0 a team that beat GE in 2-1.  Just cause you don't prepare for a team (which is crap cause they had a whole night knowing who they were going to play) means that you should still get beat by a team that is that much worse than you.  Get over your blind love for EU.  once EU actually makes a push in the big tourneys then come say something.  

Also on your point of SK vs CLG, it's not just a this tourney only thing.  the last 2 weeks teams from EU are really beating and exposing SK, and then to get even more exposed in the  Tourney is why they are falling.  Yes CLG didn't play but they have also been looking good right now while SK has been in a pretty good slump.  Hasn't EU finished in 5th and 4th respectively in the past season all star showings?  you know the ones where they take the best players and make teams of them?

EU fanboys say that EU has more talent but i honestly can't think of that many. Froggen is one of my favorite EU players but Nrated and Yellowstar are totally overrated supports and they're supposedly the best in EU. IMO EU has the weakest support players of any region. With that being said, forgiven with a support player that's actually good and he synergize well with would be really scary. But right now CLG vs SK is totally CLG all the way. Teams are starting to learn how bad SK are at the vision game and starting to figure out how to really punish them for it

H2K KaSing is the best support in the EU LCS.
Honestly I think h2k or fnatic is better than SK right now but that's just me don't hate
yoeFW comes from LMS, not GPL...

to Digidude: i'm not saying EU is stronger, I am an EU fanboy but I admit that NA is (as of now) stronger than EU. but that hasn't always been the case. I know not to fight an argument I cant support which is why I agree that EU is weaker for now, but I cant wait to see origen and how they will shape up in LCS

FNC - Seung-Hoon "Huni" Heo & Yeu Jin "Reignover" Kim
H2K - Sangwook "Ryu" Yoo
MYM - Jae-hwan "H0R0" Cho

Half of EU is now from Korea, and you bitch about NA not being NA. Typical EU saltboy.

lol 4 foreigners on TSM? I'm sorry if you don't know your geography but Canada is in North America and Turtle is from Canada. Anyway I don't get how comparing the skill pool of a region have to do with where they are from. If they play in that region they are part of the skill pool
Yah NA has outperformed EU in Worlds and Allstars consistently for the past few years. EU>NA enthusiasts don't really have an argument anymore. You word it perfectly.

Last years worlds, Fnatic was placed in a group that was already lost. I mean all asian teams and one EU team, hell not even TSM could beat that.

Meanwhile TSM had a Turkish team and a Taipei team that were low experienced.
Dont talk about skill when your so powerfull TSM won against two rookie teams in worlds to get out of group stages. 

Anyone can win against turkey and Taipei. Lets also add that 90% of NA teams have two fcking Koreans.... YEAH MAN FULL NA TEAM MY @SS. You guys cant win anything without a korean or European by your side. 

TSM has one American, two european and two Asians. That is a ot of "American" skill right there for you, considering the fact that that most of the work that team puts is done by Bot, mid and jungle, which if I´m not mistaken there are no Americans playing those roles.

Mean while the only True NA Teams like C9 and others are showing REAL NA SKILL.

In Europe, only two teams have Koreans, the rest are all Europeans, so what those that tell you? Well, they dont need to pay to win like you pathetic TSM.


Go ahead cry about it and downvote me. But TSM cant win unless there are Europeans and Koreans on the team. Admit it, Americans suck and need help to show that NA has power, when in fact they dont. They only got money.

That said, the reason TSM is not a full Korean team is because NA teams are obligated to have one native American on the team. So your dear toplaner is the reason your team is not disclalified.

Without Dyrus, TSM would have been eliminated from the LCS. So dont come showing off that an AMERICAN TEAM won an International event when in fact TSM ONLY HAS ONE AMERICAN ON THE TEAM.

If you still think NA has a chance at winning anything then you´re dumb. The only thing NA can do is buy more Europeans, chinese or Koreans into the NA LCS, just so they can CHEAT their way into worlds and finally feed their ego.

ONE thing though, yes they represent NA LCS, but they are NOT FROM NA, they are IN NA, but they are not FROM NA.

Every region has full region teams, meanwhile NA has to buy their way in order to get somewhere. Something I´m not liking one bit is that EU has started doing this aswell. 

I know it sounds round "omg you hate people from other countries to come play at others", I dont mean that, but if you want a European team, then they should be European, otherwise they arent. 

TSM is not an NA team, its an international team.
WildTurtle is more NA than Dyrus is really... Turtle is from Canada, Dyrus is from Hawaii lol
Hawaii is in the United States also...
yes yes, let the salt run through you! we don't even need to talk about tsm, cuz CLG would shit on your entire continent lol, not to mention tsm.
You sir speak the truth
Amen, the Green 8 ball  wins the game. End of discussion.
To my mind **Eu** has some really good players but **NA** has better managment and better strategist and so
Someone is just mad that EU got shit on..
when in the past two years has EU performed better than NA
Maybe Season 3 Worlds? But that was just Fnatic not falling apart in a Bo5. Otherwise, the two regions were basically even.
Nice to see NA getting more respect with TSM and CLG cracking the top 10 for the first time! Hope to see a China vs NA for Final at worlds!
Im not gonna lose hope on the Korean teams but i would love to see CLG and TSM to make it to at least the semifinals (preferably CLG ;) ).

P.S. To any possible TL members reading through here, I believe in you guys! :D <3

I've been a fan of TSM since right after rain man left, and i'm not trying to say its ever been hard to be a TSM fan, but i'm happy with where they are, I think that this list put them in the right spot, they won the international tournament, but didn't have to make a showing against teams thought to be the best in the world.
My boys from TSM making it huge also you made a mistake where it said 3 teams above GE, there are only two
I think TSM deserves the number 5 spot, above SKT... But who knows. I do know I REALLY wanna see Bjergsen and Faker play against eachother.
That game would be decided by Berg going even with Faker. If Faker doesn't snowball they are very beatable.

These are the first power rankings I can actually agree with.  NA showed a really strong performance at worlds, and was still being ranked at #15 in the rankings.  With NA winning the next international event, finally they get put in a proper place.  I don't feel like TSM/CLG are the top teams in the world, but they are on a level with teams a tier below that.  They've proven this now 2 international events in a row.

The best international rankings I've seen in a bit. Personally right now it's

CLG top ten? Fuck this joking team! This team is always a joke when it is near the World Champion every year.

Have you even been paying attention to the NA LCS at all this year? CLG has been stated repeatedly by other teams including TSM to likely be the best team in NA and has been screwed by a lack of team fight experience because they dominate early game so drastically. Trying to compare Season 5 CLG to any other lineup is a joke. This roster melds beautifully together and have proven that they will give 100% every single game. If anything you can respect the work ethic they have brought to the table this split.
but as a clg fan i think top 10 is an overstatement honestly until they can beat tsm and c9 decisively i think top 20 is ok cause yoe might even be better

We all will spout our insight over which region has the biggest talent but in the end if you screw up a game and go on tilt then all the accolades are worthless. TSM may not have had to face a powerhouse team, but not the best team wins every sports title. Any given Sunday as they say. Granted TSM will probably break some hearts in the quarterfinals at Worlds but I'll wear the TSM fanboy badge for this one. I'll still wear it even when they get 3-1'd again by whatever best team in the world is this year.

Good to see people have finally caught on to the fact that Gods can, in fact, bleed. The writing on the wall for GE was there and Korea as a whole has been clearly weaker for some time, given the mass exodus of talent to the LPL. TSM proved they are a world-class team but its difficult to say the same about the rest of the region, with C9s terrible performance

Dont sleep on Impulse though. As long as their botlane isn't a liability, there's plenty of proven talent with international experience on the rest of the team

I went ahead and watched LDG vs. EDG after IEM since it seemed like a big series, and honestly LDG played the early game poorly on so many levels, and EDG played the mid game so incredibly wrong to let LDG get back in from a 2-3k gold deficit up to a 9k gold lead at one point.  I think TSM could stand on this level, at least the way that series was played.  That said, GET/JA/SKT I would put above everyone else.  Those same macro mistakes you just don't see in LCK.

The one thing people focus on in the WE vs GET series is that GET had some stellar underperformance to allow it to happen.  By this logic, the bottom Chinese team beating the top LCK team lends credence to the idea that top Chinese teams are better than top LCK teams.  However, the narrative doesn't play up enough the idea that WE also *overperformed* in that series to a significant degree.  If GET were underperforming to around the level of LDG, and WE were overperforming to that level, a flip of the die and WE wins 2-1.

I think this series' outcome is being taken too far in the LPL vs. LCK argument. WE is such an outlier anyways bringing in a brand new roster that's impossible to plan well against, especially when they dark horse past GET's expected opponent in CJ, giving them less than 24 hours to prepare.  Basing anything off of such an unusual tournament scenario is pretty unreliable.  I'd trust instinct from watching matches and throw the WE/GET result out the window.  Maybe someone who watches a lot of both LPL and LCK can make the call.
watch more LPL then talk,  it calls LGD, NOT LDG. A man even cant write the team name correctly, then makes some trash talk, who cares?
